answers.answer: I really think you should see an ophthalmologist in person.  There are many possible causes of your symptoms including diabetes, cataract, macular degeneration, glaucoma, corneal disease, and other medical problems.  That is why it is important to see an ophthalmologist because we are medical doctors first, that specialize in eye diseases.  We can be helpful in unraveling some of these more complicated cases and can work together with your other medical doctors.  Sorry, I can make your diagnosis, you need a diagnostic workup and complete exam.MJK MD

question: For a few weeks I can not focus my eyes.  I am not able to read. Driving is becoming difficult, I have blurred vision when I look at signs.  I have one eye that wonders of to the left, as if it floats back and forth.  I have very bad pain on the left side of my neck and headaches, I feel dizzy sometimes. I have short term memory loss.I have have Cat scans MRI there is no diabetes, thyoid problems all my blood work is fine.  Yet there is not reason why I have so many problems.  It started out 3 to 4 months ago.  I was having feeling of blacking out they only happened a couple times a week, then they went to 2 to 3 times a day.Do you have any idea what may be wrong with me
title: Do not see very well
